channel.title: BBC Sport

item.title: Three players, 57 goals - who is the best striker?
item.description: BBC Sport looks at the goalscoring exploits of Harry Kane, Kylian Mbappe and Erling Haaland, who are all averaging more than a goal a game.

item.title: 'Chaos reigns as Gerrard leaves Rangers scrambling'
item.description: Maybe the time has now come for Rangers to accept that when Steven Gerrard says 'it's not you, it's me' what he actually means is the complete opposite, writes Tom English.

item.title: Glasner in Palace deal talks but needs 'right conditions'
item.description: Crystal Palace chairman Steve Parish says talks have taken place with Oliver Glasner about extending the contract of the Eagles manager as the two parties look to align their interests.

item.title: Man Utd score four against Everton to maintain unbeaten start
item.description: Substitute Jess Park scored a late double to help Manchester United secure a 4-1 win over Everton, carrying on their unbeaten start.

item.title: Wales sense 'special moment' before Belgium showdown
item.description: Wales boss Craig Bellamy wants his players to "embrace" the occasion of Monday's crucial World Cup qualifier against Belgium.

item.title: Is 'humble' Kane still England's undervalued superstar?
item.description: Harry Kane has broken goalscoring records for club and country, but is the England captain still undervalued?

item.title: Mpome 'up and about' after being knocked out at Arsenal
item.description: Brighton defender Maelys Mpome is "up and about" after being taken off the field on a stretcher, with her head in a brace and receiving oxygen during their WSL defeat at Arsenal.

item.title: 'It is not his fault' - Nagelsmann on Wirtz form
item.description: Germany manager Julian Nagelsmann defends Florian Wirtz's slow start to life with Liverpool - arguing he just needs to "get used" to the Premier League.

item.title: Arsenal earn first win in five games against Brighton
item.description: Arsenal end their four-match-long losing streak as they beat Brighton 1-0 in the Women's Super League at Emirates Stadium.

item.title: Arsenal lacked quality and composure - Williams
item.description: BBC Sport pundits Fara Williams and Anita Asante analyse Arsenal's attacking quality during their 1-0 Women's Super League win over Brighton.

item.title: Kirby reflects on first England call-up and 'Mini Messi' nickname
item.description: Former England star Fran Kirby reflects on the moment she received her first England call-up while playing for Reading in WSL2, which led to her breakthrough and being nicknamed 'Mini Messi'.

item.title: Stunning Walsh strike extends Chelsea's unbeaten league run
item.description: Keira Walsh delivers an incredible strike to break Chelsea's deadlock against Tottenham to win 1-0 and maintain their unbeaten WSL run.

item.title: How McTominay became a 'brother of Naples'
item.description: Scotland midfielder Scott McTominay reflects on his brilliant first season at Napoli, where he wants to keep giving his "absolute best".

item.title: How have the big-name striker signings done so far in the Premier League?
item.description: Strikers dominated the summer transfer window and we have taken a look at how nine of them have done since their moves.

item.title: Park double adds to England star's explosive start at Man Utd
item.description: When Jess Park switched Manchester City for Manchester United some considered it a sideways step - but she is already showing why it was a good decision.

item.title: How does Scotland's record-breaking manager Clarke stack up?
item.description: With Steve Clarke set to become the longest-serving Scotland head coach, BBC Scotland reflects on his six-year spell.

item.title: Messi stars for Miami day after being rested by Argentina for friendly
item.description: Lionel Messi scores twice in Inter Miami's 4-0 MLS win over Atlanta United, a day after being rested by Argentina for a friendly against Venezuela.

item.title: Why do footballers have private coaches?
item.description: Top footballers get elite-level training at their clubs - so why is it that some players are also turning to private coaches?

item.title: Who do Rangers fans want after Gerrard news?
item.description: Steven Gerrard disappointed Rangers by withdrawing from the race to be head coach, but how have their fans reacted and who do they now want in post?

item.title: How Germany-born striker became NI goalkeeping great
item.description: Thanks to a now defunct eligibility rule, Germany-born goalkeeper Maik Taylor became the most unlikely of Northern Ireland heroes.

item.title: 'I thought it was a heart attack' - how collapse changed Kirby's life
item.description: Former Lioness Fran Kirby reflects on the health scare that sidelined her for 10 months and her journey back to the top of the game.

item.title: Boss of England's group rivals Serbia quits straight after Albania loss
item.description: Dragan Stojkovic resigns as boss of England's group rivals Serbia immediately after his side's 1-0 World Cup qualifying defeat by Albania on Saturday.

item.title: Forest to consider Dyche if Postecoglou sacked
item.description: Nottingham Forest could turn to former Everton and Burnley boss Sean Dyche if Ange Postecoglou leaves the club.

item.title: England on brink of World Cup place as Serbia lose
item.description: BBC Sport's Ask Me Anything looks at when England could qualify for the World Cup finals in the United States, Canada and Mexico.

item.title: Grayson sacked by Hartlepool after four months
item.description: Hartlepool United sack manager Simon Grayson after four months in charge of the National League club.

item.title: Injury-time Portugal defeat 'painful' - Hallgrimsson
item.description: Republic of Ireland boss Heimir Hallgrimsson says that while his side produced a "great team performance" the manner of their late 1-0 defeat by Portugal was "painful".

item.title: Man Utd consider Palace's Wharton - Sunday's gossip
item.description: Manchester United target Crystal Palace's Adam Wharton as a solution to their midfield problem but the club will not consider Thomas Tuchel as a replacement for Ruben Amorim.

item.title: Wilshere top choice to take Luton job
item.description: Former Arsenal midfielder Jack Wilshere is the leading candidate to take over at League One Luton Town following Matt Bloomfield's departure as boss.

item.title: Gerrard rejects chance to return as Rangers boss
item.description: After talks following Russell Martin's sacking, Steven Gerrard turns down the chance to return to Rangers for a second stint as manager.

item.title: Scotland v Belarus - how you can be part of it
item.description: Your guide on how to watch Sunday's match between Scotland and Belarus in World Cup qualifying Group C on the BBC.

item.title: Newcastle name Forest's Wilson as sporting director
item.description: Newcastle United appoint Nottingham Forest's chief football officer Ross Wilson as sporting director.

item.title: The stats that say Haaland will run away with Golden Boot
item.description: BBC Sport looks at why it looks inevitable that Erling Haaland will win the Premier League Golden Boot this season.

item.title: FA Cup round-up: Hemel Hempstead stun Yeovil
item.description: A round-up of all Saturday's results in the FA Cup fourth qualifying round as two National League sides lose to lower-division opponents.

item.title: Guess the Footballers - play the quiz
item.description: We've brought back our Guess the Footballers quiz - and there are 10 players to get.

item.title: Northern Ireland outclass Slovakia in Belfast
item.description: Watch the best of the action as Northern Ireland beat Slovakia 2-0 in their World Cup qualifier at Windsor Park in Belfast.

item.title: 'My family no longer attend matches because of abuse by fans'
item.description: Premier League referee Anthony Taylor says his family "no longer attend matches" after the abuse they faced from Roma fans after the 2023 Europa League final.

item.title: Scotland strike late to beat Greece in frantic finish
item.description: Watch the best of the action as Scotland score twice late on to beat Greece and boost their hopes of qualifying for next summer's World Cup finals.

item.title: Putellas, Dumornay and Brugts - UWCL Week One best goals
item.description: The Women's Champions League 2025/26 league phase opens with stunning strikes from Alexia Putellas, Melchie Dumornay, Esmee Brugts and more.

item.title: I feel strong, fit and confident - Rice positive after win
item.description: England and Arsenal midfielder Declan Rice talks to BBC Sport about his preferred playing position following England's 3-0 win over Wales.

item.title: 'It saved me' - how Everton in the Community is changing lives
item.description: Everton defender James Tarkowski speaks with lifelong fan Sam to discuss how the club are supporting members of the community with mental health challenges.

item.title: 'Results are what qualify you and these Scotland players understand that'
item.description: Scotland head coach Steve Clarke praises his players' resilience and desire in their comeback World Cup qualification win over Greece.

item.title: The day Wales beat England at Wembley
item.description: Wales face England on Thursday hoping to repeat the heroics of their 1977 predecessors.

item.title: 'We've got mountains to do' - Cavallo on homophobia in football
item.description: Josh Cavallo, who plays for Peterborough Sports in Australia and came out as gay in 2021, tells BBC Sport football has "mountains to do" in tackling homophobia in the game.

item.title: Injury woes made Stones think about retirement
item.description: Speaking to BBC Radio 5 Live, England and Manchester City defender John Stones says he considered retiring last season because of injury.

item.title: Can 'right good' St Johnstone go all the way?
item.description: St Johnstone have a handsome lead after 10 games in the Scottish Championship - can they maintain it?

item.title: 'Terrific' Bradley will be big loss in Germany tie
item.description: Northern Ireland have a gap in defence to fill against Germany on Monday after Liverpool's Conor Bradley was booked against Slovakia, earning him a suspension.

item.title: National League to delay kick-offs in aid of 3UP promotion bid
item.description: All National League games will kick off three minutes late on 15 November, supporting the league's 3UP campaign which is seeking an extra promotion place to the EFL.

item.title: Was Tuchel right to criticise England fans?
item.description: BBC Sport looks into Thomas Tuchel's criticism of England fans during their comfortable friendly win over Wales.

item.title: 'One of our best ever' - why Pickford is England's undisputed number one
item.description: BBC Sport looks in depth at the game of England goalkeeper Jordan Pickford, with the help of former Three Lions shot-stoppers Paul Robinson and Rob Green, and his former Toffees team-mates Wayne Rooney and Theo Walcott.

item.title: 'Being gay in men's football is a very toxic place'
item.description: Australian Josh Cavallo, who moved to England in July to join non-league Peterborough Sports, says football has got "mountains to do" to tackle homophobia.

item.title: 'I deeply hurt people by moving to Saudi Arabia'
item.description: In an interview with BBC Sport, Ashleigh Plumptre says she regrets losing the trust of some LGBT fans in women's football by moving to Saudi Arabia.

item.title: Delays, distrust, dynamic prices - how 'welcoming' will World Cup be?
item.description: BBC Sport explores the issues which could make fans feel less than welcome when the World Cup takes place in the United States next year.

item.title: The younger Mbappe emerging from his brother's shadow
item.description: Being the brother of a football superstar is not easy. But Ethan Mbappe is aiming to emerge from the shadows and make a name for himself.

item.title: Transfers - September to December 2025
item.description: Check out the significant signings and departures in the Premier League, Scottish Premiership, EFL and Women's Super League.

item.title: Manager ins and outs - 2025-26 season
item.description: BBC Sport tracks all the manager ins and outs in the Premier League, Scottish Premiership, Women's Super League, English Football League and National League.

item.title: What is '007' in football?
item.description: Our Ask Me Anything Team look at what the tagline of '007' means and where the taunt came from.

item.title: Why did Man Utd's Yoro kick off a match in France?
item.description: BBC Sport's Ask Me Anything team explains why Manchester United's Leny Yoro kicked off a match in France.

item.title: What are penalty retake rules after Roma penalty drama?
item.description: BBC Sport's Ask Me Anything team explains the rules on penalty retakes after Roma took the same penalty three times against Lille in the Europa League

item.title: Why are Kazakhstan part of Uefa?
item.description: BBC Sport's Ask Me Anything team explains why Kazakhstan are part of Uefa.

item.title: Why are some football shin pads so small?
item.description: Our Ask Me Anything team explore why some football shin pads are so small, and what the laws are around wearing them.

item.title: Why was Calafiori banned from using a towel for throw-ins?
item.description: Arsenal's Riccardo Calafiori was stopped from drying the ball with a towel against Newcastle - but why did that happen?

item.title: Is the Premier League getting younger?
item.description: BBC Sport's Ask Me Anything looks into why increasing number of teenagers and young players are playing in the Premier League this season.

item.title: What do Scotland need to happen to reach World Cup?
item.description: Once Hampden has emptied after Scotland's World Cup qualifier with Belarus on Sunday, attention will turn to Denmark v Greece. But what is the best outcome?

item.title: 'Rohl new favourite for Rangers job' - gossip
item.description: Former Sheffield Wednesday boss Danny Rohl appears to be the front runner to be Rangers head coach, while Angus Gunn is touted as a possible Celtic signing.

item.title: How Harry Kane-inspired tactic is undoing Barcelona
item.description: Barcelona have lost their latest two games and there is a Harry Kane-inspired tactical tweak that teams are using to disrupt their defence this season.

item.title: From farming village to Liverpool icon - the Salah story
item.description: BBC Sport visits Egypt to discover what Mohamed Salah means to the people of the football-mad country, and how a small boy from humble beginnings became a national icon.

item.title: Napoli 'smell blood' & target Premier League's discarded stars
item.description: After Scott McTominay was a hit, Napoli went back to the Premier League for Kevin de Bruyne, could more players follow them to Serie A?

item.title: How does Daniel Levy run Tottenham - and would he ever leave?
item.description: With Tottenham struggling on the pitch and chairman Daniel Levy facing criticism from fans, BBC Sport looks at how the club is run and what the future might hold.

item.title: When River Plate icon Diaz took over fourth-tier Oxford
item.description: Twenty years on from Ramon Diaz's surprising appointment at Oxford United, BBC Sport looks at what happened and how it went.

item.title: East meets west London - the mentor who changed Chelsea
item.description: Vinay Menon knew nothing about football when he went for a meeting at a west London mansion in 2009. A few weeks later he was in the heart of the Chelsea dressing room.

item.title: The air crash and the underdogs - a triumph for a lost generation
item.description: Nineteen years and 10 miles separated Zambia's football team from a lost, golden generation on a fateful night in Libreville.

item.title: The rise and fall of North Korea - the sleeping giant of women's football
item.description: North Korea lags behind most of the rest of the world in several areas. But the hermit state has had an outsized impact on international women's football.
